content.description:
From the top of the

Barnacle

, traverse left on a good ledge to the base of the route. Climb up and left to ring piton at the base of the left crack. Jam the excellent hand and finger crack, to fun buckets all the way to the good ledge. Clip a bolt and traverse straight right 10 feet to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Gear to 2", mostly hands and fingers.

content.description:
This is the crack to the right of

Tiberone

. Start in right-angling crack that soon joins the main line. As you get higher, the protection gets a little more difficult to find, but the holds get bigger. This is a very enjoyable crack, and it shouldn't be missed if you are in the area.
content.protection: Single set of cams, wires, 60m rope. Two bolt anchor on top of route.
content.location:
Do the first pitch of

Barnacle

to reach the ledge where this climb starts.

content.description:
Feeding Frenzy is a classic St. Vrain sport route with a little lichen at the crux. This route just keeps on giving the whole way, 10+ moves after the second bolt. The holds at the crux are surprisingly good. Once past the crux, have fun turning the roof, it's easy to get sucked in on your back, but the hand jams make the exit okay.

Don't yard on the big flake to right and just below the anchors.
content.protection:
13 bolts + 2 bolt anchor.

You may want a red or yellow Camalot for the traverse under the roof with a long sling.
content.location:
It is on the right side of the wall that faces NE. Getting to the base of this climb is not easy, enter the gully and proceed up (watch for loose rock) until you can traverse right to a ledge. Do a scary step across, and continue on the ledge until you enter the upper right side of the gully.

To descend, rap the tree.

content.description: Start in the broken crack system a few feet right of a small tree growing on the wall. The first part of the route take gear, but the upper headwall has three bolts. This route doesn't see much traffic, and as a result has plenty of lichen. The climbing seemed pretty stout for the grade, but is well protected.
content.protection: Gear + bolts. Two-bolt anchor gets you down.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
